Description: Three fragments of child's woollen sock in knotless netting technique; 1) 9x9cm, ii) 7.5x10cm, iii) 2x2.5cm; mainly undyed wool but toe of dark green wool with a band of red, around ankle a band of red and dark blue wool and another band of red and blue on top edge; on one side, above band round ankle, an embroidered cross in orange and red wool - long vertical arms and shorter horizontal arms, all finishing at corners in perfunctory curls; just above cross is a stitched cord of undyed linen, probably the remains of a tie string; top edges missing; embroidery in orange and red wool (S spun Z ply), linen (S spun Z ply S twist); dark blue wool (S)
Curator's comments: Unreg. 121; a sock illustrated in the following reference is so like this sock as possibly to be the same or the pair - A. Gayet, Le costume en Egypte du IIIe au XIIIe siècle (E. Leroux 1900), no. 19 (p.99), said to be from Deir el-Dyk, near Antinopolis; purchased 7/11/1989 in Hele/Fritz Ikle sale at Christies, South Kensington, Lot 123
